info.label: VP, Engineering
info.brief: VP of Engineering at SportsRecruits. Experienced in software engineering team management, full stack web development, product engineering, cloud architecture and infrastructure, and devops. Open to consulting requests as availability allows.

history.summary: Empowering a team of talented software engineers to build software to help student-athletes pursue their dreams.
highlights: Empowering and providing mentorship to a team of talented full stack, back end, and front end engineers
Increase team output, efficiency, and accuracy on projects and product delivery
Manage and improve complete software development life cycle
Evaluate new technologies and its cost effectiveness at various levels of the tech stack

history.summary: Lead the efforts to rebuild several key product features including a messaging system, activity feed, college and majors search, with modern technologies.
highlights: Replaced Codekit workflow with a Gulp.js & Webpack build process
Built the new 'outside the gate' marketing experience featuring HTML5 video and CSS3 animations
Built new mobile experience for the Event Beacon product with React and node.js to allow college coaches to look up players and take notes on the field at events on their mobile phones
Built new mobile responsive applications for the messaging system, activity feed, and college search with Ember.js utilizing a micro services architecture
Built new event registration flow in the order process with an accompanying CMS to manage applicants and wait list
Built an internal campaign management system to track tutorial views and usage of new features
Set up automated pipeline deployment system by connecting our JIRA instance and workflow with Jenkins

history.summary: As one of the first members of the new Prototype team, I had the opportunity to implement a new workflow and base infrastructure for the team. The goal was to lay the groundwork that allows us to rapidly create prototypes for the purpose of user testing and proof of concept. For every prototype our team is tasked with, I evaluate and propose the tech stack to use, usually centering around JavaScript based frameworks and libraries. As part of the prototype launch process for testing, I created and maintain staging servers to power these applications. A notable project I worked on was the trading and portfolio prototype built with the MEAN stack.
highlights: Integrated front-end workflows for a new team
Used static site generators to populate and build templates
Reduced development time by streamlining process with build scripts
Extensively used preprocessors for OOCSS
Created reusable mock API
Maintained and constructed responsive prototypes with a variety of JS frameworks
Wrote and maintained a collection of modules for consistent, organized components
Implemented CSS regression testing
Built widgets in AngularJS and generated results with d3.js charting library
Fixed time sensitive bugs in production widgets by using TDD
Set up staging server using Ubuntu and nginx to support and proxy to static sites, PHP, node.js, Ruby and Python web applications
Implemented application processes monitoring
Automated deployment process with deploy scripts
Redesigned and built the initial prototype of the new trading and portfolio platform

history.summary: I was brought on full time at Expand The Room after my successful trial freelance work and this gave me the chance to explore the world of front-end MVC frameworks. Aside from building microsites and the occasional bug fix, I built a demo weather app using KnockoutJS and later rebuilt it in AngularJS and dived into the MEAN stack to evaluate how it could be used for future client projects.
highlights: Built proof of concept web applications with KnockoutJS, AngularJS, & MEAN stack
Maintain and apply bug fixes to mobile applications using Titanium Studio
Created microsites with HTML5 and CSS3 animations

history.summary: After taking relevant courses with Launch School (previously Tealeaf Academy), I was invited to work with them as their first teaching assistant. I conducted code reviews with students on their homework, organized and monitored their study sessions, and mentored them throughout the courses.
highlights: Assist primary instructor in teaching Introduction to Ruby and Web Development, Rapid Prototyping with Ruby on Rails and Building Production Quality Applications courses.
Help students with questions regarding code and homework assignments
Debugging problems involving RSpec tests, background processes, email sending, code refactoring, and payment processing

history.summary: Using the skills I acquired over the years, I wanted to experience going solo. I worked on projects the ranged across all platforms, from PHP based CMS and blog sites to custom applications using Ruby on Rails. I learned front-end work flows and back-end development to round out my knowledge required to successfully complete these projects. A few projects of note were a gaming site/community, a yoga studio site, and a responsive portfolio site.
highlights: Ruby on Rails, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3 for client projects

history.summary: In order to try out new technologies, I took a freelance position with ExpandTheRoom. I helped worked on a few mobile apps using Appcelerator Titanium Studio. The first mobile app was for a promotional event by Jim Beam where you could take a photo of someone with an iPad and generate a 'devilized' photo. The second mobile app was for US Weekly to consume JSON data and render the associated photos, videos, and content in the proper view and screens.
highlights: Developing mobile apps with Appcelerator Titanium Studio

highlights: Built sites for different brands using Twitter Bootstrap, HTML5 Boilerplate, CSS3, and jQuery
Ensured that sites gracefully degraded to usable state and supported sites in Internet Explorer 7+, Opera, Chrome, Safari and Firefox
Prototyped layouts with grid systems from wireframes
Integrated SASS into project workflow
Used CSS3 media queries to build responsive websites and integrated custom jQuery code for different screen resolutions
Customized and implemented a web based HTML5 Canvas drawing tool with Javascript
Used git to track updates and merge changes for use on development, staging and production servers

history.summary: As the senior front end developer on this team, I helped implement the latest best practices in web development by evolving their web sites from table-based layouts to semantically correct, section 508 compliant layouts. I also had the opportunity to create concepts for their proprietary CMS homepage modules and contributed to the design and development of their photo slider feature. This position allowed me to play with a lot of experimental technologies which allowed me to make informed decisions on how to implement an experience that degrades with browser support.
highlights: Helped customers over the phone regarding help with daily maintenance of websites
Converted Adobe PSD files into standards-based HTML5/CSS3/jQuery
Built sites with emphasis on Section 508 web accessibility and ADA standards
Sliced well over 600 websites and integrated with SchoolSitePro CMS software
Expert in progressive enhancement (graceful degradation) of websites to support the latest HTML5/CSS3 features
Made design changes to PSDs and produced graphical mockups
Used Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop to design critical elements and sections using common practices of typography, grid, and color theory
Handled all requests and tickets pertaining to code conflicts and subtle cross-browser nuances including Internet Explorer 6+, Firefox, Chrome, Opera & Safari
Redesigned outdated modules into table-less format with pure CSS
